newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Falling house prices highlight S.Africa woes - bank.
newsitem.headline: Falling house prices highlight S.Africa woes - bank.

text.p: South African house prices fell in the third quarter, the first decline in nominal terms since the fourth quarter of 1986, Amalgamated Banks of South Africa (ABSA) said on Wednesday.
The average price of a medium-sized house declined by one percent in the three months to end-September from the year ago level, the bank said in its latest quarterly housing review.
In real terms this amounted to a price fall of 7.7 percent, the sixth consecutive quarter of declines after taking account of inflation.

The bank said the downtrend in house prices was due to various factors including sharp rises in municipal rates, continued emigration of professionals, persistent high crime levels, high interest rates, a squeeze on consumers and a general slowdown in the economy.
